DOCNAME: CASE OF CREDIT AND INDUSTRIAL BANK v. THE CZECH REPUBLIC
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Not necessary to examine P1-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a bank , a joint stock company with its registered office in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG Česká národní banka ) ( “ the ORG ” ) , pursuant to section CARDINAL ) of LAW ( no . CARDINAL ) ( zákon o bankách ) ( “ the LAW ” ) , placed the applicant bank in compulsory administration with effect from DATE to DATE , on the grounds that the financial situation and liquidity of the applicant bank had repeatedly been unsatisfactory and that the previous measures had not remedied the situation . A compulsory administrator ( nucený správce ) was appointed to replace the applicant bank 's statutory body . The decision ( rozhodnutí ) contained a notice to the effect that the provisions of administrative procedure did not apply to it and that no appeal lay against it .
CARDINAL . On DATE the compulsory administration decision was published in the Commercial Bulletin ( obchodní vĕstník ) .

CARDINAL . In a ruling ( usnesení ) of DATE the Prague CARDINAL ORG ( obvodní soud ) ( “ the ORG ” ) , upon the ORG 's proposal , decided to allow an entry concerning the compulsory administration and the appointment of the compulsory administrator to be made in ORG ( obchodní rejstřík ) . The ruling fixed the date of DATE as the date of the entry in ORG and stated that the compulsory administrator represented the applicant bank . The ruling was not served on the applicant bank . On DATE , the compulsory administrator and a representative of the ORG came to the bank and informed all employees that the applicant bank had been placed in compulsory administration . The representative of the ORG served the ORG 's decision of CARDINAL DATE on Mr Moravec , the chairman of the bank 's ORG and its majority shareholder . On DATE ORG confirmed its ruling of DATE by issuing a certificate of legal validity ( právní moc ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG extended the compulsory administration until DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant bank 's legal representative , Mr Choděra , sent his power of attorney to ORG , and requested that the proposal for an entry concerning the compulsory administration and ORG decision delivered in this regard be sent to his office . He noted that under LAW ) of LAW , the applicant bank was a party to the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE notice of the extension was published in the Commercial Bulletin . In a ruling of CARDINAL DATE ORG , upon a proposal of the ORG , approved an entry concerning the extension in ORG . The court did not hold a public hearing . On DATE it confirmed the ruling by a certificate of legal validity . The ruling was not served on the applicant bank .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE respectively , the applicant bank , represented by the chairman of its ORG and PERSON , its legal representative , having become aware of the existence of the rulings of CARDINAL DATE and DATE , appealed against them to ORG ( městský soud ) ( “ the ORG ” ) . It claimed that it should have been treated as a party to the proceedings in which the court had approved the entries concerning the compulsory administration and its extension in ORG , and contended that the rulings had not been served on it . The applicant bank also claimed that the ORG 's decision of CARDINAL DATE had not been sufficiently reasoned and that it was therefore not able to say whether the compulsory administration had been imposed in accordance with the law or not , and that the decision contained an incorrect notice to the effect that no appeal lay against it . It added that when the rulings of ORG were served on it , it would make more complete submissions .
CARDINAL . In a ruling of CARDINAL DATE , rejecting the appeals against the rulings of CARDINAL DATE and DATE without holding a public hearing , ORG stated , inter alia :

“ ... the decisions of the [ ORG ] concerning the imposition of compulsory administration and its extension were fully within its competence under LAW of [ the LAW ] . ... In the light of the decision of DATE , compulsory administration was imposed because of the repeatedly unsatisfactory financial situation ... of the bank . Section CARDINAL ) of [ the LAW ] expressly states that administrative law applies to the procedure concerning the imposition of penalties ... Administrative law does not , therefore , apply to other decisions taken under LAW ... It is true that the court of first instance acted incorrectly when it did not notify both rulings to the appellant . However , it is apparent from the appeals which the appellate court considered to have been lodged in time that [ the appellant ] has become familiar with both of them ... [ Moreover ] , the entries in ORG were made [ by the court of first instance ] in accordance with LAW [ of LAW ] . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant bank , represented by the chairman of its ORG and PERSON , filed an appeal on points of law ( dovolání ) with ORG ( Vrchní soud ) against ORG ruling of CARDINAL DATE , pursuant to Articles CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL § CARDINAL(d ) of LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE the bank lodged a constitutional appeal ( ústavní stížnost ) with ORG ( GPE PERSON ) against ORG rulings of DATE and DATE and ORG ruling of CARDINAL DATE , with a proposal to repeal sections CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL ) of the Act .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG extended the compulsory administration until DATE . On DATE notice of the extension was published in the Commercial Bulletin . In a ruling of CARDINAL DATE ORG , upon a proposal by the ORG , approved an entry concerning the extension in ORG . The court did not hold a public hearing . On DATE , it approved the ruling by issuing a certificate of legal validity . The ruling was sent to the office of Mr Choděra . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the applicant bank , represented by PERSON , appealed against the ruling to ORG .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE , ORG had declared the applicant bank 's constitutional appeal inadmissible , finding , inter alia , that the ruling of CARDINAL DATE had not been served on the parties to the proceedings and , therefore , had not become final .

CARDINAL . On DATE Act No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , which amended the LAW as regards , inter alia , the procedure on compulsory administration , came into force . Section IV provided that the LAW was applicable in all cases where compulsory administration had been imposed before that date .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ruling of ORG of DATE was served on the applicant bank and thereby became final .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant bank , represented by the chairman of its ORG and PERSON , renewed its appeal on points of law against ORG ruling of CARDINAL DATE . The appeal contained the same arguments as in the previous appeal , which appeal had , however , been lodged before the notification of the ruling .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant bank , represented by the chairman of its ORG and PERSON , lodged a second constitutional appeal against ORG ruling of CARDINAL DATE . It pointed out that the ruling had become final by its notification and that , therefore , an appeal lay against it to ORG . It submitted that it should have been a party to the proceedings on entries in ORG and that all decisions relating to these proceedings should have been served on it . It further challenged an allegedly wrong interpretation of section CARDINAL ) of the LAW by ORG and suggested that this provision , together with CARDINAL ) of the LAW , should be repealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant bank 's appeal against ORG ruling of DATE as being lodged by an unauthorised person . The court found that the applicant bank 's statutory body had , pursuant to section CARDINAL ) of the LAW as amended , been replaced by the compulsory administrator , who alone could represent the bank or authorise a legal representative , but who had not granted such authorisation to Mr Choděra .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG decided that the compulsory administration would not finish on DATE , but would be terminated for CARDINAL of the reasons indicated in section CARDINAL of the Act as amended . On DATE that decision was entered in ORG .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE , the applicant bank , represented by the chairman of its ORG and by Mr Choděra , had lodged a third constitutional appeal , this time against ORG ruling of CARDINAL DATE . It complained , in particular , that ORG had violated the applicant bank 's right to be protected by a court considering that its appeal had been lodged by an unauthorised person . It further suggested that section IV(CARDINAL ) of Act No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL should be repealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared inadmissible the applicant bank 's second constitutional appeal against ORG ruling of CARDINAL DATE , holding in particular that when the constitutional appeal had been lodged , ORG had been dealing with the applicant bank 's appeal and the appeal on points of law filed in the meantime had still been pending . Accordingly , no final decision had been given at that stage .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant bank 's third constitutional appeal as being unsubstantiated and as being lodged by an unauthorised person . The court stated , in particular :

“ ... ORG founded its decision expressly on section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of [ the LAW ] ... according to which a compulsory administrator replaces the statutory body of a bank during compulsory administration . ... [ The applicant bank 's legal representative ] was not authorised by the compulsory administrator of the bank to make an appeal or lodge a constitutional appeal .

... ORG found from the case file of the Prague CARDINAL ORG that the decision imposing compulsory administration ... was ordered by the [ ORG ] on DATE ... The compulsory administration became effective , in accordance with section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of [ the LAW ] , by its registration in ORG , pursuant to the GPE CARDINAL ORG ruling of DATE which became final on DATE . ...

Moreover , according to [ the LAW ] , administrative law was not applicable to proceedings concerning compulsory administration , with the exception of cases explicitly referred to in this LAW ( sections CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL ) . Administrative law became applicable only after the entry into force of Act No . CARDINAL ( section CARDINAL ) ) . To that end , an administrative complaint could be lodged against a decision given by the [ ORG ] ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) . An administrative complaint could also be made under LAW ) of [ the LAW ] . However , only by LAW CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the [ LAW ] as amended did the [ ORG ] become obliged to notify its decision on compulsory administration to [ the bank ] . In addition the administrative complaint does not have suspensive effect ( section CARDINAL) ... ”

CARDINAL . On DATE , pursuant to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the Act as amended , the ORG withdrew the applicant bank 's banking licence ( povolení působit jako banka ) and on DATE , on an appeal of the applicant bank , it confirmed that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG instituted bankruptcy proceedings against the applicant bank .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG stayed the proceedings instituted on DATE by the applicant bank , represented by Mr Choděra , against the ORG and the compulsory administrator , requesting the latter to fulfil his obligation ( o splnění povinnosti nuceného správce ) . It stated that the applicant bank had not submitted a power of attorney .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , to which the appeal on points of law against ORG ruling of CARDINAL DATE had been referred , stayed the proceedings on the ground that PERSON had not paid the court fees despite having been ordered to do so by the court 's ruling of CARDINAL DATE , which was modified on DATE and served on him on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed ORG ruling of DATE , stating , inter alia :

“ There is no doubt that the claim was made on DATE and that a power of attorney issued by the applicant bank 's statutory body was attached to it . There is also no doubt that on DATE bankruptcy proceedings were instituted against the bank ... ( By DATE ) the company that had been declared bankrupt had not lost its capacity to act in legal proceedings but only the right to dispose of property forming part of the estate of the company . By section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(h ) of Bankruptcy and Equalisation Act No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL [ ( zákon o konkurzu a vyrovnání ) ] , powers of attorney relating to the property forming part of the estate of a company declared bankrupt lose their validity . However , that was not so in the present case ... ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared inadmissible the applicant bank 's appeal on points of law against ORG ruling of CARDINAL DATE . It held that pursuant to LAW , an appeal on points of law was admissible if a party to the proceedings could not act as a result of a procedural step taken by the court . According to the law then in force , compulsory administration became effective on the date on which the relevant entry was made in ORG ; the applicant bank 's own statutory body was therefore empowered to act on its behalf until that date and to appeal against the ruling of ORG on the registration of the compulsory administration in ORG . ORG had then to notify its ruling to the applicant bank . However , in the present case the applicant bank had validly appealed against the ruling concerned to ORG , which had considered it on the merits . Seeing that the ruling was not reasoned , notification of it could not improve the procedural position of the applicant bank . ORG added that the fact that the applicant bank had not received the text of the ORG 's proposal for the entry concerning the compulsory administration in ORG did not remove the applicant bank 's right to act in proceedings before the court as provided for in LAW .

In so far as the appeal on points of law concerned the entry of the first extension of the compulsory administration in ORG , ORG pointed out that section CARDINAL of the LAW as in force at the time when compulsory administration had been imposed provided that compulsory administration became effective on the date on which the relevant entry was made in ORG , the functions of the statutory body of the bank being suspended by the appointment of a compulsory administrator until the compulsory administration ended . In the present case , on DATE the statutory body of the applicant bank had been replaced by the compulsory administrator , who alone was entitled to appeal in the proceedings concerning the proposal for an entry concerning the extension of compulsory administration to be made in ORG . However , the appeal against ORG ruling of CARDINAL DATE had been lodged by PERSON who had acted on the basis of a power of attorney issued by PERSON , chairman of the applicant bank 's ORG , on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG likewise declared inadmissible the applicant bank 's appeal on points of law against ORG ruling of CARDINAL DATE . It stated , inter alia , that LAW provided that an appeal on points of law was admissible if the person who acted as a party to the proceedings lacked the capacity to be the party to those proceedings . The applicant bank claimed that the compulsory administrator had not had the capacity to be the party to the proceedings . ORG stated that in the present case the applicant bank had the capacity to be a party to the proceedings ; another question was who could act on its behalf before the court .

ORG then examined the conditions of admissibility of the applicant bank 's appeal on points of law under LAW . It stated that according to the law then in force , compulsory administration became effective on the date on which the relevant entry was made in ORG ; on that date the statutory body of the bank was replaced by the compulsory administrator . Article CARDINAL(b ) § CARDINAL of LAW provided that the court decided on the contents of the entry in ORG without holding a hearing . It specified the date of the entry in its decision . The entry had to be effected within DATE after the decision had been taken . ORG underlined that the date of the entry in ORG was not to be confused with the date on which the decision authorising the entry was delivered , with the date of its notification , or with the date on which the court approved the decision by issuing the certificate of legal validity . The court concluded that the compulsory administrator alone was entitled to appeal in the proceedings concerning the proposal to make an entry in ORG of the second extension of the period of compulsory administration . However , the appeal against ORG ruling of DATE had been lodged by PERSON who had acted on the basis of a power of attorney issued by PERSON , chairman of the applicant bank 's ORG , on CARDINAL DATE . Consequently , the applicant bank had not had the right to have its appeal examined on the merits by the appellate court .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant bank , represented by PERSON , lodged a fourth constitutional appeal , this time against CARDINAL decisions of ORG , alleging a violation of LAW .

CARDINAL . Until DATE compulsory administration proceedings were governed by LAW ( No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) ( “ the LAW ” ) . LAW ) of the LAW provided that compulsory administration was a measure which ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) , as an administrative authority under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of ORG ( No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , could impose upon a bank if it did not comply with the conditions laid down in its banking licence and/or if it infringed the law . Under section CARDINAL , the ORG was empowered to impose compulsory administration on a bank if the bank 's financial situation and liquidity failed considerably or repeatedly to satisfy the conditions laid down in the LAW , and previous measures or sanctions had not remedied the situation . Under section PERSON ) , compulsory administration became effective on the date of the relevant entry in ORG , the ORG not being required to notify the bank of its decision to place it in compulsory administration . Before registration , the decision to impose compulsory administration was published in LAW . Section CARDINAL ) provided that the functions of the bank 's statutory body were suspended by the appointment of a compulsory administrator until the end of the compulsory administration . Under section CARDINAL , the compulsory administrator was entitled to take measures necessary to restore the stability and liquidity of the bank concerned , including closure of its branches or other administrative units . Under section CARDINAL , compulsory administration could be terminated by : ( a ) revocation , if there were no longer any reasons for its continuance ; ( b ) expiry of the period originally fixed by the ORG , if that period had not been extended ; and ( c ) withdrawal of the bank 's banking licence .

LAW did not oblige the ORG to notify its decision concerning the imposition of compulsory administration to the bank concerned . It did not specify the maximum period of compulsory administration , did not contain any reference to the application of administrative law to compulsory administration proceedings , did not specify the parties to the proceedings and did not indicate any remedy against a decision imposing compulsory administration .

CARDINAL . Compulsory administration proceedings were modified by Act No . CARDINAL ( “ the LAW as amended ” ) which entered into force on DATE . It was applied to all cases in which compulsory administration had been imposed before that date . Pursuant to the new section CARDINAL ) , administrative law applies , inter alia , to proceedings concerning the imposition and withdrawal of compulsory administration , unless LAW provides otherwise . The bank is the sole party to the proceedings ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) which can also be institute by the notification of the decision ( section PERSON ) ) . Pursuant to the new section CARDINAL ) , the ORG shall notify a member of the bank 's ORG ( představenstvo ) or a member of its ORG ( dozorčí rada ) or a person empowered to direct the bank of its decision imposing compulsory administration on the bank . The bank can lodge an administrative complaint ( rozklad ) against such a decision . The complaint does not have suspensive effect ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) . Pursuant to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) , the functions of all organs of the bank are suspended upon the notification of the compulsory administration decision . The compulsory administrator assumes the functions of the statutory organ . Section CARDINAL(c ) limits the maximum period of compulsory administration to DATE .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW No . ORG ) recognises as a party to proceedings any person whose rights , obligations or interests protected by law are to be dealt with , or whose rights , obligations or interests protected by law may be directly affected by an administrative decision . Article CARDINAL provides that any administrative decision taken by a central ORG administrative authority at first instance may be contested by an administrative complaint lodged within DATE from the date on which the administrative decision was served .
CARDINAL . Certain provisions of LAW were also applied in the present case .
Article CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that “ unless otherwise provided by law , the court shall decide in the form of a ruling ( usnesení ) ” .
LAW provides , inter alia , that “ the court shall serve a ruling on the parties if such ruling may be appealed against or an appeal on points of law is filed ... ”
Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that “ if the ruling does not impose a duty of performance , it becomes enforceable ( vykonatelný ) as soon as it is served ” .
Article PERSON ) provides that
“ ( CARDINAL ) In proceedings concerning an entry in ORG , the court shall examine whether all the conditions required by the statutory provisions for making such entry are met .

( CARDINAL ) The court decides on the content of a particular entry by a ruling without holding a hearing . The verdict in the ruling shall state the date of the entry . The entry is to be made within DATE of issuing the decision on the content of such entry .

( CARDINAL ) The provisions on disciplinary fines shall apply if a company fails to comply with the court 's request to notify the court of the facts , or to submit the documents , required for making an entry under LAW . ”
Article CARDINAL provides that
“ An appeal on points of law ( dovolání ) is admissible against a decision of an appellate court if :
( b ) a person who acted as a party in the proceedings lacked the capacity to be such party ;
( f ) a party to the proceedings was deprived from acting before the court through a faulty procedure applied by the court . ”
Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL(d ) provides that an appeal on points of law may be filed “ if a decision was based on incorrect legal consideration of the case . ”
LAW of the Code governs the conditions for the review of decisions of administrative authorities ( správní žaloba ) .
Article CARDINAL provides :

“ ( CARDINAL ) The provisions of this LAW shall apply to cases when an individual or a legal entity claims that his or its rights were curtailed by a decision of an administrative authority and a request for review is filed with the court seeking a review of that decision from the viewpoint of its legality .

( CARDINAL ) Regarding a decision issued as part of administrative proceedings by an administrative organ , the provisions of this LAW shall only apply to a review of that decision in respect of which all ordinary legal remedies admitted by law have been made use of and the decision in question has become final .

Article CARDINAL ) § CARDINAL provides that the request for review shall be filed within DATE of the notification of the decision of the administrative authority in the last instance , unless the law provides otherwise .
Under LAW , the facts at the time when the decision in question was given are decisive . No examination of evidence takes place .
Article ORG ) § CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that the court , upon finding that the decision in question has been made in accordance with law , shall reject the request for review .

Article ORG ) § CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that the court , upon finding that the administrative authority did not consider the matter correctly from the legal point of view or that the facts on which it founded its decision were contrary to the content of the file , shall quash the decision and may return the matter to the indicated administrative authority for further proceedings . The court shall also quash a decision when it emerges during a hearing that the decision can not be reviewed because it is incomprehensible or because of lack of reasons .
CARDINAL . Finally , LAW No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) provides that the facts entered in ORG become effective with respect to everyone from the date on which the entry is made .
